> [[ Underground: Averron City – Market District // Neutral Territory // PVP Enabled ]]

“Speaking of Andor—he's been bugging me about something weird happening at the Altar earlier.” Ayla continues, and you smile at her words, watching her expression grow more pensive on the other side of the video call. She's starting to think about her words, and sounds overall more severe; you think she might be slipping back into character. News of your actions has spread impressively far; you've barely spent any time in Averron, and you've already “You weren't there when that was going on, by chance? I'd like to hear someone else's side of the story...”

“Yeah, I was there.” You say. “Actually, that was me.”

She looks dumbfounded, and you continue.

“I found out you could offer the Unique Identifiers of dead players to the statue.” You suggest, folding your arms and leaning against a derelict market stall. “I'm surprised no one's tried it yet.”

“People have been hoarding them,” she replies, “In hopes of finding a way to resurrect the dead, or a way to break them down for materials. We're not sure what they're made of—but we might be able to cannibalize them for more impressive technology, upgrade them, or even replicate them, as a way of bringing new players into the game.”

“Well, my friend and I offered some we came across on a rogue Nameless, and they disappeared. With a nice light show, mind you, but totally gone otherwise.”

“Disappeared?” She asks. “Did the players come back to life?”

> [[ 1/3 ]]
name: BSO
subject: [[ Broken Sky Online Quest - Session 3 ]]

comment:
>>37731816

“I don't know.” You shake your head. “I've got a feeling they didn't, but it might be a step in the right direction. Next question's this: you know Andor and Liza well, right? What do you think about the Disposable Heroes and the Crimson Guardians?”

“New-blood.” Yeah, she's back in character. “You expect me to sit here and play twenty questions with you?”

You nod confidently, expressionless. “Yes.”

She grits her teeth, turning a bit red in the face. “...I.”

“Well?”

“They're.” Ayla sighs, trying to regain her composure. It's easy to throw her off—when she gets serious, she's used to expecting everyone around her to do the same. “The Heroes are laid-back, but there's not a whole lot of leadership among them. Andor's been enforcing the neutrality policy around town, whereas the rest of the officers are pushing recruits toward the surface project. We've barely made progress, though the top Techs have been hashing out blueprints for some sort of excavator—it'll take more than what we've got to get it up and running.”

“And the Guardians?”

> [[ 2/3 ]]
name: BSO

comment:
>>37731832

“Liza is a girl of few words, and she runs a tight shift.” Ayla shrugs. “As the Alliance leaders, we've a private message board for the three of us and some of our guilds' officers. She doesn't really put her two cents in unless she thinks we're doing something wrong, or badly. You're thinking about them—is that why you're turning down my offer? You'd have to be more decorated, even now, for them to let you in the front door, and she'd see to it that you were properly humiliated before you left. You can't just—”

“I'm said I'm not turning down your offer, Ayla.” You shake your head. “I said I'm weighing my options. It's too early for me to decide. Now, I've got a couple of people waiting on me, so I believe I'll see you later.”

“Yeah,” she says, “Later.”

The call closes, the top and bottom of the video projection folding together with scan lines like an old-school television. You accept Ayla's contact request, and an image of her smiling face appears next to her name. Your list is in alphabetical order—Ayla, Nel, and Smith. Three friends already!

You're supposed to be meeting up with Nel and the rest of his new party near the warehouse district in just a few minutes; you dismissed them a moment ago to deal with Ayla, as well as handle some other responsibilities.

Seems you've made quite an impact already.

> Investigate the market stalls, and sell your unused items.
> You're fine for now—log out and get a snack before your first dungeon run.
> Meet with Nel early. Let's get this show on the road!
> Other.
name: BSO

"This ability, the unknown one." You begin to ask about the unknown ability you have, but aren't sure how to vocalize it. You use your UI to project your skill menu onto the table, and point at it for the fortune teller.

"Mm, yes."

The conversation stalls. The NPC appears as if they're beginning to speak; then, their animations abruptly reset with a noticeable twitch.

They go through that same un-nerving smile from before, repeating the phrase, intoned the same way.

"Strange, that you would fancy this meeting when our futures are so murky."

You pause, instinctively blurting. "What?"

"One can see many things in the ether, and learn more from the Celestials. Uncover their artifacts by searching carefully in your travels through dangerous locations, and you will find the truth in a matter of time." They tilt their head. "My sight is much vaster than many. Clear your mind, child, and allow me to alleviate your worries. Where shall I direct my gaze?"

It gets quiet, as you head for the warehouse district. The streets widen up a little bit, large, empty-looking buildings flanking you on either side. You were told not to come out here alone, but you're just going to the gate, and you can see a guard not terribly far away. You pick up the pace.

Nel waves at you, loitering nearby the outside of the city. There's a couple of unfamiliar figures standing around him, and he introduces you as you come within proximity.

"Everyone, this is Ascheritte." He smiles ear-to-ear.

"Going to introduce me to everyone else?" You ask.

"Well, if no one else wants to go first." There's a man with short brown hair and a bluish robe--it's short, and done up a bit so it looks like a duster. He's got a staff in one hand, and strikes you as seeming awfully generic. "I'm Rhett, an Artificer. Trying to find some cool elemental foci to put on things. I can't really take a hit, but I'll go wherever I'm needed."

"Mhm." He gestures to a short girl with facial markings, hair done up to look like cat ears; she's wearing a pair of studded leather gauntlets, and her forearms and chest are bound with bandages. "This is Tatsumaki. English isn't her first language, so she's not super talkative."

"Hi." Tatsumaki speaks quietly.

"Hello. Are you sure communication won't be an issue, Nel?" You ask.

"I've seen her fighting outside." Rhett interrupts. "She seems pretty good."

"Vision." The last man is about your height, with skin darker than yours, and a rifle--a longcaster--slung over his back. "Just trying to learn my way around this place."

"Now, then." Nel says. "If everyone's ready, let's head off to the lower quarter. Got what you wanted, Ash?"

"Yeah. Let's fight some cave monsters before we dig too deep, eh?" You suggest. "Get a feel for our group dynamic."

"Sure." Nel responds. "Thinking ahead."

"I like." Rhett says. Tatsumaki just smiles and nods.

"I'm good for whatevs." Vision shrugs.

The five of you head out of the city, staying close together as you follow a series of spiraling caves downward, beneath Averron City. Below, it's noticeably colder, and bridges are shrouded by the white fog you saw from above.

"Low visibility here." Nel seems to have straightened up a bit. He's walking cautiously, knives drawn. "This route leads down to the ruins, but there's an area below that widens up where we should find some monsters, as well as a few spider caves if you're feeling up to it."

"Gotcha. By the by," You say, "Have you guys talked to the fortune teller in town? The consultations are interesting. He told me there might even be a Celestial Altar down here."

"We could make another Averron." Rhett chuckles. "Y'know, under this one. Or anything else, assuming we're the first to find it."

You recall what Ayla said: that the offering was waiting for her when her and the other alliance leaders paved the way into what's now Averron City. "How many Celestial Gems do you think it took to make Averron? They aren't just going to leave that lying around, are they?"

"Hell, I'd first ask for a rocket launcher or somethin'." Vision chuckles. "Seems more useful than another city right under ours."

"So you're not planning on splitting the loot?" Nel asks.

"Fine, fine." Vision responds. "A rocket launcher for each of us."

There's a rumbling from overhead; you see a worm-like shape in the fog, wriggling its way into a distant cave wall.

"Crawlers." Nel says, assuming a fighting stance.

"Mm?" Rhett says. "I haven't seen one of those yet."

"Well, I think they see us, which means we're on a clock. I don't think they're special, but anything can go. Light on your feet, or they'll ambush from below."

> [[ 67 ]]

It barely misses, bursting forth from the ground beneath you, and keeps coming, segmented body twice as long as you are tall, with more eyes than you can count at a glance, a pair of pincers, and gnashing mouth-parts. It's the same color as the cave stone you walk on. Gravel, bits and pieces of stone rain down around you, and you can feel each one on your skin, grit in your eyes.

You dive backwards as the crawler emerges, letting it skim past you, and flop heavily onto the stone floor. At a glance, the rest of the party is a bit scattered. It makes sense; cooperating is easy enough in a regular game, but here, you have to remain physically situationally aware of everything underway around you. You're almost overwhelmed for a moment as you swirl around, attempting to take everything in.

Rhett and Nel are scrambling apart, attempting to dodge a pair of creatures diving at them like a pincer attack. Counting your target and Vision's, there's a total of four crawlers. You don't see Tatsumaki anywhere, and don't have time to look without giving up your chance to counterattack; your assailant is crawling towards you quickly already.

Straight through: your blade hits flesh, between body segments, a pair of exoskeleton plates. It continues through, and the creature screeches as you follow the swing into a dodging maneuver, diving sideways to avoid danger, or a final attack from the dying crawler.

> You defeated crawler. [[ Party: Nel, Tatsumaki, Vision, Rhett ]]

There's another gunshot as you recover from your roll and keep moving. A flash of light pierces the fog, and there's another screech, lower in pitch this time, and accompanied by a guttral growl.

> Vision defeated crawler. [[ Party: Nel, Tatsumaki, Ascheritt, Rhett ]]

Vision looks hurt; his shirt is bloodied, but he's still on his feet. There's screeching through the fog, and you turn towards the source. Tatsumaki is dancing circles around her crawler, and you notice she's still unarmed.

It misses a dive, and goes in for a charge, but she intercepts, punching its head into the ground with a gauntlet-clad fist, and following up with a painful looking stomp that lands heavy enough to crack the stone beneath.

The crawler flails, sweeping her legs out from under her, and she tumbles to the ground on the opposite side of it—"Oof!"

Nel and Rhett are still dealing with a pair, but doing a fine job avoiding damage; Nel is supporting, going for flanking dagger strikes that don't seem to be doing a whole lot, while Rhett isn't being terribly effective either. His staff is now tipped with a burning fireball, and he's waving and prodding it at the crawlers as they approach; he can't seem to land a hit, but he's keeping them at range as they shy away, frightened by the flames.

Then, you hear more rumbling from below. This time, louder, and lower in pitch.

"Is everyone alright?" You ask.

On the other side of the enormous crawler corpse in front of you, Nel is slumped over Rhett's broken, motionless body. His ribcage is collapsed, and his dim, dented UI lies under him.

"Fuck... I wasn't fast enough..."

At some point, you leveled up. You didn't even notice.

Vision is silent, and Tatsumaki seems to bear a frown. There's a long pause, where you just look and listen to the cave around you. It's still too real. You don't want to be the one to break the silence, but otherwise you'd all just stand here for the rest of the night. It's just a game. You take a deep breath before speaking. "Should we go ahead and loot them?"

"Yeah," Vision says, with a sigh. "Let's see what we've got, and how we want to split it. Everyone good?"

Nel doesn't respond, leaving the rest of you to mull over inventory.

As the three of you stumble over the giant crawler's broken body, you see a faint glint of light, and everything changes. It appeals to you in a way you don't understand, but you might remember: a familiar scent, a warm touch, something you've lost, and thought you'd never see again.

You struggle, forcing yourself to take your eyes off it. Vision appears transfixed, slowly reaching to grab the loot, while Tatsumaki just stands slack-jawed, quivering, a bit red-faced.

"I think... I'm gonna go ahead and take that..." Vision says. "...if no one minds."

>>37741784

"If we've found one here, there might be more to follow, right?" Tatsumaki and Vision still stand transfixed, and seem upset with you when you reach to grab the Celestial Gem; they don't say anything, but their eyes widen in protest. You're having a hard time coming to your senses too--hey, wasn't she upset about Rhett's death, just a second ago?

Your hand is shaking, and you say something that you think will ease their minds, just so you can have it. "Maybe we can use it to bring Rhett back."

They seem satisfied, if only mildly. As the Celestial Gem vanishes into your inventory, your feeling of want and anxiety goes with it.

But, now, you want more, and you never want to let it go.

"That leaves two of these crystals, six worm teeth, and this orb." You suggest. "So, I guess I can take..."

"I think you've taken enough, haven't you?" Vision seems noticeably agitated. "There are four of us, remember?"

He helps himself to one of the crystals and a pair of worm teeth before wandering over to Rhett's body, nudging Nel as he draws within proximity. "Kid, go get your share."

"Just give it to Ashe." He pouts.

"Yeah, sure. Whatever." Vision begins fiddling with his UI, and you hear the sound of a credit transfer from your own; 73 credits have come your way. Tatsumaki takes the earthen orb, leaving a fractalline crystal and another pair of teeth to you. "Kid, you want any of Rhett's stuff?"

"I'll look." Nel sighs. "I don't deserve it, though..."

"Idiot." The gunner tosses his rifle over his shoulder. "It wasn't your fault, alright? No one could have seen this coming. The people that die are doing us a greater favor than you know: they're making the mistakes we don't have to. Use it, or lose it."

You need more Celestial Gems.

maybe I should make a skill tree one of these days

You mess around with the EXP menu, and are able to get as far as ability choices before it forces you to commit.

It might have saved you some thinking to do this earlier. Either way, you have two points to allocate, and will do so before continuing.

> [[ Offensive Mastery 1 offers a choice from: ]]
* Concussive Strike // Active // Spend PP to make an attack that deals increased damage and can knock targets back a significant distance. Required for: "Overpower", "Charge", "Whirlwind Attack".
* Critical Threat // Passive // Slightly increases critical strike range. Required for: "Fleshrend", "Unarmed Fighter".
* Weapon Mastery // Active // Increases the effectiveness of wielded weapons. Required for: "Two-handed Mastery", "Dual Wield Mastery", "Whirlwind Attack".

> [[ Defensive Mastery 1 offers a choice from: ]]
* Iron Body // Passive // Reduces incoming damage. Required for: "Panacea", "Combat Regeneration".
* Lightning Reflexes // Passive // Increases dodge chance. Required for: "Evasion", "Retaliate", "Intercept".
